segments.text: I notice how the woman's focus is solely on the plate in her hand, completely ignoring the chaos unfolding.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s almost serene, the way she polishes it, as if everything is right with the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But in the back of my mind, I can’t help but feel a growing dread as the water spills onto the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her obliviousness is almost heartbreaking; she seems so content yet so out of touch with reality.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I look at the boy, stretching out for the cookies, his little body almost defying gravity.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He looks so proud, yet I want to tell him to get down before he gets hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is standing there, her eyes wide, almost glowing with excitement, waiting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s sweet, but I feel a twinge of concern for the safety of everyone in this scene.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: There’s a thin line between a fun adventure and a disaster, and I fear they are about to cross it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The idyllic garden outside seems so far removed from the tension building in this kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR
